name: apple production | apple | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21116/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of apples. The average yield from 2016 is 37.3  t/ha. The data are representative for apple production in South Africa. ;;The dataset includes the establishment of the orchard (including the tree seedlings, planting of the trees, 1281 trees/ha, and the trellis), inputs of fertilisers (N-P2O5- K2O from mineral fertiliser input: 169-61-73 kg/ha*a ) and pesticides (input of 67.9 kg/ha*a, including naptha/mineral oil application), fertiliser and pesticide packaging, irrigation water (6048.5 m3 per ha and year)  and machine operations (mulching, mowing, tillage, fertiliser and pesticide application). Furthermore, direct field emissions, pesicide emissions to the soil, heavy metal emissions to the soil and water, and land use change are included. ;;;;;;;

This activity starts with the establishment of the orchard. 

This activity ends with the clearing of the orchard after an average lifetime of 20 years.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0124:Growing of pome fruits and stone fruits

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for South Africa
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: From CCC data to the entire industry based on national production statistics on yields from 2016.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Real industry data from Confronting Climate Change (CCC) http://www.climatefruitandwine.co.za/. Inventory modelling following the ecoinvent Guidelines.

exchanges.description: Apple, South African production. Output of apple, produced for direct human consumption.

flow.name: apple
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0124:Growing of pome fruits and stone fruits

exchanges.description:
Calculated value: emissions arising from fertiliser use, calculated according to Nemecek und Schnetzer (2011). Soil erosion according to Kooman & Critchley; Le Roux at al. (2008); UWC (2015), P content in topsoil according to Nemecek, Kägi T. & Blaser S. (2007), enrichment factor for P according to Wilke & Schaub (1996), fraction of eroded soil that reaches river according to Nemecek, Kägi & Blaser (2007).  
Further references: Kooman, G.; Critchley, W. R. S. GIS-Assisted Modelling of Soil Erosion in a South African Catchment: Evaluating the USLE and SLEMSA Approach. In Water Resources Planning, Development and Management; Breetzke, G. D., Ed.; InTech, 2013 ISBN 978-953-51-1092-7; Le Roux, J. J.; Morgenthal, T. L.; Malherbe, J.; Pretorius, D. J.; Sumner, P. D. Water erosion prediction at a national scale for South Africa. Water SA 2008, 34, 305–314; UWC Erosion Available online: http://www.botany.uwc.ac.za/envfacts/facts/erosion.htm (accessed on Apr 28, 2015); Nemecek, T., Kagi, T., & Blaser, S. (2007). Life Cycle Inventories of Swiss and European Agricultural Production Systems. Final report; Wilke B. & Schaub D. (1996) Phosphatanreicherung bei Bodenerosion. Mitt. Deutsche Bodenkundl. Gesellsch. 79, 435-438.

Calculated value: calculated according to Nemecek und Schnetzer (2012). Soil heavy metal contents according to Keller & Desaules (2001), erosion average value according to Kooman & Critchley (2013), Le Roux et al. (2008) and UWC Erosion (2015), accumulation factor according to Prasuhn (2006), erosion factor: 0.05, since surface waters between agricultural fields are rare and the distance to the next river or lake is greater than 100 m according to Freiermuth (2006), heavy metal content of inorganic fertilisers according to Desaules & Struder (1993), deposition and content of seeds according to Freiermuth (2006), heavy metal content of pesticides according to Perkow & Ploss (1994) in Freiermuth (2006). 
Further references:  
Keller T. & Desaules A. (2001) Böden der Schweiz: Schadstoffgehalte und Orientierungswerte (1990 – 1996). Umwelt-Materialien Nr. 139. Bern: Bundesamt für Umwelt, Wald und Landschaft BUWAL.
Kooman, G.; Critchley, W. R. S. GIS-Assisted Modelling of Soil Erosion in a South African Catchment: Evaluating the USLE and SLEMSA Approach. In Water Resources Planning, Development and Management; Breetzke, G. D., Ed.; InTech, 2013; 
Le Roux, J. J.; Morgenthal, T. L.; Malherbe, J.; Pretorius, D. J.; Sumner, P. D. Water erosion prediction at a national scale for South Africa. Water SA 2008, 34, 305–314.; 
UWC Erosion http://www.botany.uwc.ac.za/envfacts/facts/erosion.htm (accessed Apr 28, 2015). 
Prasuhn V. (2006) Erfassung der PO4-Austräge für die Ökobilanzierung SALCA Phosphor. Agroscope Reckenholz - Tänikon ART, 20p. Online at http://www.art.admin.ch/themen/00617/00744/index.html?lang=en.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'apple' is calculated to be circa 1.03E-02 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonium nitrate, as N', 'calcium nitrate', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 2.07E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: Calculated value: 100% of input quantity. Calculated based on 2009 pesticide application values from Dabrowski, Shadung, & Wepener (2014) and König (2015), with data on total production area from Hortgro (2015). Further references: Koenig, A. (2015). Environmental hotspots and the potential of clean technologies in the South African fruit supply chain. Master thesis at Zurich University of applied Sciences (ZHAW), Institute of Natural Resource Sciences, unpublished; Hortgro (2015) Key Deciduous Fruit Statistics 2014, Hortgro, Paarl, South Africa.

Calculated value: calculated according to Nemecek und Schnetzer (2012). Leaching rates according to Wolfensberger & Dinkel (1997), heavy metal content of inorganic fertilisers according to Desaules & Struder (1993), deposition and content of seeds according to Freiermuth (2006), heavy metal content of pesticides according to Perkow & Ploss (1994) in Freiermuth (2006). 
Further references: 
Wolfensberger U. & Dinkel F. (1997) Beurteilung nachwachsender Rohstoffe in der Schweiz in den Jahren 1993-1996, FAT und Carbotech, im Auftrag des Bundesamtes für Landwirtschaft, Bern;
Desaules A. & Studer K. (1993) NABO: Nationales Beobachtungsnetz, Messresultate 1985-1991, Schriftenreihe Umwelt Nr. 200, BUWAL (Bundesamt für Umwelt, Wald und Landschaft), Bern; 
Freiermuth R. (2006) Modell zur Berechnung der Schwermetallflüsse in der Landwirtschaftlichen Ökobilanz - SALCA-Schwermetall, Forschungsanstalt Agroscope Reckenholz-Tänikon (ART), 28p
Walther U., Ryser J.-P. & Flisch R, 2001. Grundlagen für die Düngung im Acker- und Futterbau 2001. Agrarforschung, 8 (6): 1-80.
Perkow W. und Ploss H., 1994. Wirksubstanzen der Pflanzenschutz- und Schädlingsbekämpfungsmittel. Berlin: Blackwell Wissenschafts-Verlag.

Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of apple is calculated to be circa 6.71E-04 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[thio]carbamate-compound', 'bipyridylium-compound', 'copper', 'glyphosate', 'mancozeb', 'organophosphorus-compound, unspecified', 'pesticide, unspecified', 'phenoxy-compound', 'triazine-compound, unspecified'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.34E-03 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

Soil heavy metal contents according to Keller & Desaules (2001), erosion average value according to Kooman & Critchley (2013), Le Roux et al. (2008) and UWC Erosion (2015), accumulation factor according to Prasuhn (2006), erosion factor: 0.05, since surface waters between agricultural fields are rare and the distance to the next river or lake is greater than 100 m according to Freiermuth (2006), heavy metal content of inorganic fertilisers according to Desaules & Struder (1993), deposition and content of seeds according to Freiermuth (2006), heavy metal content of pesticides according to Perkow & Ploss (1994) in Freiermuth (2006). 
Further references:  
Keller T. & Desaules A. (2001) Böden der Schweiz: Schadstoffgehalte und Orientierungswerte (1990 – 1996). Umwelt-Materialien Nr. 139. Bern: Bundesamt für Umwelt, Wald und Landschaft BUWAL.

exchanges.description:
Calculated value: calculated according to Nemecek und Schnetzer (2012). Soil heavy metal contents according to Keller & Desaules (2001), erosion average value according to Kooman & Critchley (2013), Le Roux et al. (2008) and UWC Erosion (2015), accumulation factor according to Prasuhn (2006), erosion factor: 0.05, since surface waters between agricultural fields are rare and the distance to the next river or lake is greater than 100 m according to Freiermuth (2006), heavy metal content of inorganic fertilisers according to Desaules & Struder (1993), deposition and content of seeds according to Freiermuth (2006), heavy metal content of pesticides according to Perkow & Ploss (1994) in Freiermuth (2006). 
Further references:  
Keller T. & Desaules A. (2001) Böden der Schweiz: Schadstoffgehalte und Orientierungswerte (1990 – 1996). Umwelt-Materialien Nr. 139. Bern: Bundesamt für Umwelt, Wald und Landschaft BUWAL.
Kooman, G.; Critchley, W. R. S. GIS-Assisted Modelling of Soil Erosion in a South African Catchment: Evaluating the USLE and SLEMSA Approach. In Water Resources Planning, Development and Management; Breetzke, G. D., Ed.; InTech, 2013; 
Le Roux, J. J.; Morgenthal, T. L.; Malherbe, J.; Pretorius, D. J.; Sumner, P. D. Water erosion prediction at a national scale for South Africa. Water SA 2008, 34, 305–314.; 
UWC Erosion http://www.botany.uwc.ac.za/envfacts/facts/erosion.htm (accessed Apr 28, 2015). 
Prasuhn V. (2006) Erfassung der PO4-Austräge für die Ökobilanzierung SALCA Phosphor. Agroscope Reckenholz - Tänikon ART, 20p. Online at http://www.art.admin.ch/themen/00617/00744/index.html?lang=en.

Calculated value: calculated according to Nemecek und Schnetzer (2012). Heavy metal content of inorganic fertilisers according to Desaules & Struder (1993), heavy-metal contents of organic fertilisers according to Freiermuth (2006) from Menzi & Kessler (1998) and Desaules & Studer (1993), dry matter content from Walther et al. (2001), heavy metal content of plant material according to Mattos at al. (2003), heavy metal content of pesticides according to Perkow & Ploss (1994) in Freiermuth (2006), deposition according to Freiermuth (2006), heavy metal content in exported biomass according to Freiermuth (2006). 

AND 

copper emissions arising from the use of copper oxychloride.  Calculated value: 100% of input quantity. Calculated based on 2009 pesticide application values from Dabrowski, Shadung, & Wepener (2014) and König (2015), with data on total production area from Hortgro (2015). Copper oxychloride application: 2.96E+00 kg/ha*a. Stoichiometric calculation: Cu(OH)3Cl: molecular mass: 213.57, Cu: 63.55, Cu: 59.51%

Further references: 
Koenig, A. (2015). Environmental hotspots and the potential of clean technologies in the South African fruit supply chain. Master thesis at Zurich University of applied Sciences (ZHAW), Institute of Natural Resource Sciences, unpublished; Hortgro (2015) Key Deciduous Fruit Statistics 2014, Hortgro, Paarl, South Africa.
